title: Designing the home lab sync
content:
I rebuilt my home lab sync so that laptops and the edge box share a common playbook. Everything lives in plain shell scripts, rsync, and a small JSON manifest that lists which folders are authoritative.

The manifest is the only source of truth: it defines what to pull, what to push, and which exclusions to honor. Because it is human-readable, I can adjust priorities on the fly without touching code.

This setup makes disaster recovery boring. If a disk dies, I bootstrap a fresh node, feed it the manifest, and watch it rebuild state with predictable, observable steps.
